Warne died of a heart attack earlier this month.

175.title: Telangana's veteran CPI(M) leader Mallu Swarajyam passes away at 91
175.article_body: Telangana's veteran communist leader Mallu Swarajyam passed away due to multiple organ failures in Hyderabad on Saturday. The 91-year-old CPI(M) member participated in the Telangana People's Armed Struggle (1946-51) against feudal lords and Razakars during the Nizam rule. As a candidate of CPI(M), she was elected to the state Assembly of undivided Andhra Pradesh for two terms (1978 and 1983).

176.title: 3 Haryana women killed as jeep overturns while trying to save animal
176.article_body: At least three women were killed and 11 injured after the pickup jeep in which they were travelling overturned in Hisar district of Haryana on Saturday, police said. The accident occurred after a stray animal came in front of their jeep. The driver tried to avoid hitting the animal and lost control of the jeep.

177.title: Hoping B'wood doesn't make any more remakes; don't want to see more: Ananya
177.article_body: In a recent interview, actress Ananya Panday said that she hopes there aren't any more remakes in Bollywood. "I'm really happy with this. This path that we're going down is where we're kind of telling an original, braver, complex story," she added. "So, I'm kind of in that phase where I don't really want to see more remakes," Ananya said.

178.title: 45-yr-old man kills wife's lover in TN after learning about their affair; held
178.article_body: A 45-year-old man in Tamil Nadu's 15 Velampalayam allegedly killed his wife's lover after learning about their affair and following the murder, the accused was arrested by the police on Saturday. The deceased man was staying at a rented accommodation. His wife died a few years ago and he was staying along with his two sons, mother and younger brother.

179.title: Had an orgasm while watching Jaideep Ahlawat in Paatal Lok: Zeeshan Ayyub
179.article_body: In a recent interview, actor Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub spoke about his favourite characters of his co-star Jaideep Ahlawat. Zeeshan said he almost had an "orgasm" after watching him in 'Paatal Lok'. When Jaideep was asked the same question, he said Zeeshan's character from 'Raanjhanaa' is his favourite. "I was in love with him in 'Raanjhanaa' as Pandit Ji," he added.

180.title: Labourers attacked with glass bottles for playing Bhojpuri music on Holi
180.article_body: A group of labourers from Bihar was allegedly attacked with glass bottles by a group of around eight to 10 youths at a factory in Haryana's Raipur Rani for playing Bhojpuri songs during a DJ party on Holi. One of the victims alleged that the accused told the DJ to play Punjabi music. Police have arrested two persons so far.

181.title: Portion of Ludhiana road caves in due to water leakage, area barricaded
181.article_body: A one-foot long portion of a road in Punjab's Ludhiana caved in on Saturday. Municipal Corporation officials said that there was leakage in one of the water supply connections due to which sand might have eroded leading to the road to cave in. Police installed a barricade around the damaged site. No accidents were reported.

182.title: Russia bombs Mariupol art school that was housing 400 residents: Ukraine
182.article_body: Russian forces on Saturday bombed an art school where around 400 residents were taking shelter, said Mariupol city council. As per the local authorities, the school’s building was destroyed and people could be under the rubble. As of now, there is no confirmation of casualties. Earlier, Russian forces bombed a theatre in Mariupol where civilians were sheltering.

183.title: Bee attack killed man in custody: Bihar Police after mob kills ASI, sets station on fire
183.article_body: After a mob allegedly set fire to a police station in Bihar and killed an assistant sub-inspector (ASI) over an alleged custodial death of a villager, Bettiah SP UN Verma claimed the man died after being attacked by bees. Verma said the incident took place when the deceased was drinking water from a hand pump on the police station premises.

184.title: Shane Warne given lap of honour at private funeral in Melbourne, pics surface
184.article_body: Shane Warne's family and friends bid the cricketing legend farewell at a private funeral in Melbourne on Sunday. Warne's three children and parents were joined by around 80 guests, including Michael Clarke and Michael Vaughan, at the service. Warne was given a lap of honour at St Kilda's home ground with Coldplay's 'Fix You' playing in the background.

185.title: Speeding auto overturns as youths throw water balloons at it in UP, video surfaces
185.article_body: An autorickshaw met with an accident after being struck by water balloons hurled at it by local youths in UP's Baghpat. A video of the incident shows the auto, that was moving at high speed, overturning after being hit by water balloons on Holi. At least two people along with the auto driver were injured in the incident.

186.title: World Bank to give ₹7 cr to build modernised slaughterhouse in Pune
186.article_body: The World Bank will give the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) ₹7 crore to construct a modernised slaughterhouse in the city, officials have said. This project will help citizens in getting good quality meat and stop the illegal slaughter of animals, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. A PMC Veterinary Officer said that the civic body-owned Kondhwa slaughterhouse will also be upgraded.

187.title: Jennifer Lopez, Affleck to buy estate with 10 bedrooms, 17 bathrooms for $50 million: Reports
187.article_body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck are buying an estate worth $50 million in the Bel-Air area of Los Angeles, as per reports. The estate is spread across 20,000 square feet and has 10 bedrooms, 17 bathrooms, multiple kitchens, a theatre and gym among other things, reports added. The house is super private, surrounded by trees, reports further said.

188.title: Poland begins issuing identification cards to Ukraine refugees
188.article_body: Over 1,23,000 personal identification number (PESEL) cards have been distributed to refugees from Ukraine in Poland since Wednesday, Polish authorities have confirmed. These cards will enable refugees to reside, study, work, avail medical and social benefits in Poland for the next 18 months. Poland has taken in over 2 million refugees from Ukraine since the Russian invasion last month.

189.title: We need to focus on what we need to get ready for 1st game: DC coach Ponting
189.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said he's focusing on what they need to get ready for their match of IPL 2022. He added, "I had a great first session with the players. There's an energetic vibe around the team." Ponting further said, "I'm going to have breakfast, lunch and dinner with all the younger guys that I don't know."

190.title: Gurugram authorities to remove encroachments along 2.2-km long road
190.article_body: The Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) will carry out an anti-encroachment drive along a 2.2-kilometre long road between Hero Honda Chowk and Umang Bhardwaj Chowk in Gurugram from Monday. The drive is being carried out ahead of the expansion of the road in the area. The support of the police for demolishing the encroachments has been sought, the HSVP said.

191.title: Bengaluru Police arrests 2 from TN for threats to hijab case judges
191.article_body: Bengaluru Police has arrested two persons for allegedly issuing threats to the special bench judges of the Karnataka HC who upheld the hijab ban in the state's educational institutions. The arrests were made on Saturday night and the accused are office bearers of the Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamath. The state has now announced 'Y' category security for the three judges.

192.title: Inspect sites in 1st half of working days: Delhi PWD to officials
192.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) has asked its officials to devote first half of all working days to site inspection to ensure construction projects are completed on time. PWD also asked officials to submit brief field inspection reports to the Superintending Engineer on a daily basis. Officials will have to submit on-site photographs to the Engineer-in-Chief every day, it added.

193.title: Kajol gets body-shamed by trolls for her outfit; fans react, 'Let her live'
193.article_body: Actress Kajol Devgan recently attended film producer Apoorva Mehta's 50th birthday in Mumbai. For the occasion, the actress wore a black bodycon dress, while many appreciated her choice, some trolls body-shamed her. A user commented on the video, "Omg is she pregnant?" Defending the actress, one of her fans wrote, "She's healthy and looks her age. Just let her live."

194.title: You'll have to work 30 hours a day: Kejriwal to Punjab MLAs
194.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday told Punjab MLAs to work hard and fulfil targets set by Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. "A day of 24 hours won't be enough. You'll have to work 30 hours a day," Kejriwal said. "If you don't meet the targets, then people will say change the minister...[then] we'll have no option," he added.

195.title: He was one of the best ever for India: GT's Dayal on head coach Nehra
195.article_body: GT pacer Yash Dayal said having Ashish Nehra as head coach is great for the franchise as he has seen it all as a player and a coach in IPL. "As a left-arm fast bowler, he [Nehra] was one of the best ever for India," he added. The 24-year-old left-arm pacer will be making his IPL debut in upcoming season.

196.title: Bhopal jail prisoners get training to become priests, being taught rituals
196.article_body: Training for becoming priests is being given to 50 prisoners of the Bhopal Central Jail. They are also taking lessons on performing various Vedic rituals. "We are training these prisoners as they are cloistered from society...They are being taught rituals so that they can work for well-being of people," a member of the institute providing training to the prisoners said.

197.title: Grandfather, brother held for rape of 11-year-old Pune girl; search on for father, uncle
197.article_body: Pune police investigating a case of alleged rape and sexual abuse of an 11-year-old girl by four of her family members have arrested her grandfather and detained her 14-year-old brother. Teams have been dispatched for the arrest of her father and uncle, police added. An FIR in the case was registered based on a complaint filed by a school counsellor.

198.title: Govt working on classification of cryptos under GST law: Report
198.article_body: The government is reportedly working on the classification of cryptocurrencies as goods or services under the GST law. "There's a clarity needed in regard to levy of GST on cryptocurrencies and whether it has to be levied on the entire value," an official told PTI. Currently, the government levies 18% GST on the services provided by the crypto exchanges.

199.title: Fired cruise missiles on Ukraine from Black Sea, Caspian Sea: Russia
199.article_body: Russia has said that it carried out strikes on Ukraine using cruise missiles launched from ships in the Black Sea and Caspian Sea and hypersonic missiles from Crimean airspace. It was done to destroy a fuel storage facility the Ukrainian military was using, said the Russian Defence Ministry. The Russians also struck a Ukrainian military preparation centre.

200.title: 2 arrested for allegedly smuggling 2 tonnes beef worth ₹6 lakh in Pune
200.article_body: Two people were arrested for allegedly smuggling two tonnes of beef worth ₹6 lakh in the Pimpri-Chinchwad area of Pune district, a police official said. The seizure was made from a truck during checking late Friday night, he added. The accused have been charged under the Indian Penal Code and Maharashtra Animal Preservation Act provisions, the official further said.

201.title: Girls are gutted, we have lost 3 games in WC by 2-3 wickets or few runs: Devine
201.article_body: NZ captain Sophie Devine has said girls are gutted after their one-wicket defeat against England in the Women's ODI World Cup. "We have lost three games by 2-3 wickets or a few runs...the hard thing is we could've done a lot of things differently," she added. NZ are placed sixth on the points table with two wins in six games.

202.title: Kashmir Files earns ₹24 cr on Sat, Akshay's 'Bachchhan...' collects ₹12 cr
202.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' collected ₹24.8 crore in India on Saturday. Meanwhile, Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bachchhan Paandey', which was released in theatres on Friday, witnessed a dip in its collection by earning ₹12 crore on day two. As per film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the action-comedy film, directed by Farhad Samji, had begun its box office journey with ₹13.25 crore.

203.title: ABVP ex-chief, accused of peeing at elderly widow’s doorstep, arrested
203.article_body: Former ABVP national president Dr Subbiah Shanmugam was arrested on Saturday for allegedly harassing a 62-year-old widow back in July 2020 in Chennai. He is accused of urinating and throwing garbage including used surgical masks at her doorstep over a disagreement related to parking space use. Shanmugam, a medical college professor, was suspended from service recently, said police.

204.title: Censoring 'The Kashmir Files' is an attack on our freedom: Ex-New Zealand Dy PM
204.article_body: New Zealand's former Deputy Prime Minister Winston Peters has sought the release of 'The Kashmir Files' in his country saying that censoring it would be an "attack" on freedom of New Zealanders. "The film is about true and real events...To censor this film is tantamount to...removing from public knowledge all images of the attack on 9/11," said Peters.

205.title: KKR's Tim Southee marries longtime girlfriend ahead of IPL 2022, shares pic
205.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) fast bowler Tim Southee got married to his longtime girlfriend Brya ahead of IPL 2022. Southee took to Instagram to share a picture from the wedding, writing, "Forever." The couple have two daughters together, Indie May Southee and Sloane Ava Southee, who were born in 2017 and 2019 respectively.

206.title: So influenced by looks: Mira on tweet criticising Ukrainian President's outfit
206.article_body: Shahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput defended Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and criticised US financial expert Peter Schiff's tweet questioning his outfit. Peter had tweeted, "Times are hard, but doesn't the President of...Ukraine own a suit?" Reacting to it, she wrote, "You'd ask him to wear cufflinks if you could...Seriously! Are we getting so influenced by looks...that we forget reality."

207.title: Man stabs 25-yr-old man as car hits two-wheeler in Ahmedabad
207.article_body: A 25-year-old man, Deepak Thakore, was stabbed by another man, Kunal Shah, who asked him to "drive properly" after the latter's car hit Deepak's two-wheeler. Reports said that Kunal and his parents reached Deepak's house, where Kunal abused Deepak and threatened to kill him. Deepak asked Kunal to leave, following which, Kunal stabbed Deepak.

208.title: Saudi Aramco's net profit more than doubles to $110 billion in 2021
208.article_body: Oil giant Saudi Aramco on Sunday reported that its annual net profit for 2021 has more than doubled amid soaring crude oil prices. Aramco said its net profit increased by 124% to $110 billion in 2021, compared to $49 billion in 2020. The company has further announced that it plans to boost its capital expenditure to $40-$50 billion this year.

209.title: Uttarakhand MLAs to take oath tomorrow: BJP state chief
209.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP head Madan Kaushik has claimed that all newly elected members of the state Legislative Assembly will take oath on Monday. "All newly elected members...will take oath at 11 am in Vidhan Sabha tomorrow," said Kaushik. He further informed that the state's CM will be announced after the meeting of the Legislative Party in the evening.

210.title: ₹224 cr undisclosed income found during raids on Maharashtra-based unicorn
210.article_body: The Income Tax department found an undisclosed income of about ₹224 crore after it raided a unicorn startup based in Pune and Thane in Maharashtra. While the firm is engaged in wholesale and retail of construction materials, the Central Board of Direct Taxes said that its annual turnover exceeded ₹6,000 crore. Unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore has also been seized.

211.title: Whole country is talking about Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann & his works: Kejriwal
211.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal addressed Punjab AAP MLAs on Sunday and said that the whole country is talking about CM Bhagwant Mann and his works. "Compensation for crops damaged in October has been released and farmers will get cheques in the coming days. You have done good work within three days of forming the government," Kejriwal added.

212.title: 'People know where he goes for walk', K'taka HC Chief Justice gets death threat
212.article_body: An advocate has filed a case over a video of a man threatening to kill Karnataka High Court Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi over hijab ban verdict. He said the man referred to the alleged murder of a Jharkhand judge, who was killed on morning walk. The complainant added the man said people know where Chief Justice goes for walk.

213.title: 877 newborns died as women refused hospital delivery during COVID: Meghalaya govt
213.article_body: As many as 877 newborn babies and 61 mothers died as pregnant women refused to get themselves admitted to hospitals for institutional delivery during the COVID-19 pandemic due to fears of contracting the disease, the Meghalaya government told the NHRC. The NHRC had registered a case over the high number of maternal and newborn deaths in the state during pandemic.

214.title: Sharad Yadav merges his LJD party with Lalu's RJD after parting ways 25 yrs ago
214.article_body: Former Union Minister Sharad Yadav on Sunday merged his Loktantrik Janata Dal (LJD) party with Lalu Prasad Yadav-led Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) in Delhi. The two leaders had parted ways 25 years ago. "Merger of our party with RJD is first step towards Opposition unity. It's imperative that whole Opposition gets united across India to defeat BJP," Sharad said.

215.title: Success is built on OTT today, I'd love to explore OTT space: Govinda
215.article_body: Actor Govinda said in an interview that he would love to explore the digital medium. "Times have definitely changed since we started out, and things have evolved to a point where success is built on OTT platforms today," he added. "OTT is a platform for all kinds of artists, and I would...love to explore...OTT space as an actor," said Govinda.

216.title: Ukraine Prez suspends 11 political parties with links to Russia
216.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a video address on Sunday said that activities of 11 political parties with links to Russia have been suspended for the period of martial law amid the conflict between the two countries. The suspended parties included Viktor Medvedchuk-led Opposition Platform for Life. Medvedchuk claims that Russian President Vladimir Putin is his daughter's godfather.

217.title: Kanye barred from performing at Grammys over 'concerning online behaviour'
217.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has been barred from performing at the Grammy Awards 2022 due to his "concerning online behaviour", said his representative. This comes after West's Instagram account was suspended for 24 hours this week for posting racial comments against 'The Daily Show' host Trevor Noah. Earlier, Noah had criticised West for his posts about his ex-wife, Kim Kardashian.

218.title: US is offering rewards of up to $5 million for info on Russian oligarchs' assets
218.article_body: The US government is offering rewards of up to $5 million for anyone who can provide information leading to the seizure of assets belonging to Russian oligarchs. Under the program, assets can include yachts, jets, and properties situated in the US. The government has also provided names of 28 Russians, for which they are interested in receiving information.

219.title: 64-yr-old man dies after branches of banyan tree fall on him in Mumbai
219.article_body: A 64-year-old man died after the branches of a banyan tree fell on him in Mumbai's Matunga Road. "The injured person was...taken to PD Hinduja Hospital, where doctors declared him dead," an official from the control room of BMC's disaster management cell said. The branches also damaged some shops near the restaurant, as per reports.

220.title: Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' release postponed, film to release on July 29
220.article_body: The release of Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' has been postponed. The film, which was slated to release on July 15, will now hit the screens on July 29, taking the recently-vacated date of Dwayne Johnson's DC film 'Black Adam'. Also starring Sandra Bullock and Aaron Taylor-Johnson, 'Bullet Train' is an action-thriller film directed by David Leitch.

221.title: I still feel it is not in the spirit of the game: Brian Lara on 'mankading' rule change
221.article_body: After MCC announced 'mankading' will be considered a regular run-out and won't be included in 'unfair play' section of rule book, ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara said, "I still feel it is not in the spirit of the game." Earlier, Ravichandran Ashwin had urged bowlers to not have "second thoughts" on running non-strikers out.

222.title: DC share video of their team room in Mumbai
222.article_body: Delhi Capitals took to Instagram to share video of their team room in Mumbai ahead of IPL 2022. The video shows their recreation room wherein one can see table tennis and pool tables, and video games among other things. The video also features a terrace zone. Delhi Capitals will face Mumbai Indians in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27.

223.title: Woman dies after son attacks her with weapon over property dispute in Delhi
223.article_body: A 53-year-old man, Bhagwan Das, was arrested for allegedly attacking his 76-year-old mother with a weapon in Delhi, leading to her death one day later. Police found that the woman's children began hitting each other over property dispute and Das later attacked her. Police said that the woman was unfit to give statement before passing away.

224.title: I'm from Hindi Medium; never faced roadblocks because of my language: Pankaj
224.article_body: When asked if language ever created any obstacle for him in Bollywood, actor Pankaj Tripathi said he's from Hindi medium background and it has been an advantage for him. "I don't think I ever had to face any...roadblocks because of my language," he said. "If you know from where you come from, you're ready to face any problems," he added.

225.title: Ukraine to get US’ Javelin and Stinger missiles within days, says official
225.article_body: Ukraine's National Security official Oleksiy Danilov has said that the country will receive US weapons including Javelin and Stinger missiles to help them fight against the Russian forces. "The (weapons) will be on the territory of our country in the nearest future. We are talking about days," said Danilov. Ukraine has so far received weapon shipments from several countries.

226.title: One of Europe's biggest steel plants in Ukraine damaged by Russia, video surfaces
226.article_body: Azovstal, one of Europe's biggest steel plants, was damaged as Russian forces attacked the Ukrainian port city of Mariupol, officials said. Sharing a video on Twitter, Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko wrote, "The economic losses for #Ukraine are huge. The environment is devastated." "We will return to the city, rebuild the enterprise and revive it," Azovstal Director General Enver Tskitishvili said.

227.title: Carpenter from UP shot at, 3 CRPF personnel injured in grenade attacks in J&K
227.article_body: A carpenter from Uttar Pradesh was shot at and three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel were injured in two separate grenade attacks by suspected militants in Jammu and Kashmir. The carpenter, who was critically injured, was immediately shifted to SMHS Hospital in Srinagar, where he is undergoing treatment. Police have registered cases in connection with the terror crimes.

228.title: 'The Kashmir Files' won't provide political advantage to anyone: Sanjay Raut
228.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said it is not right to do politics on a sensitive issue like Kashmir. "'The Kashmir Files' is just a film, I don't think it will provide any political advantage to anyone in the coming elections," Raut added ahead of the BMC elections. "By the time elections come, the film will be gone," Raut stated.

229.title: All not well in BJP, says Digambar Kamat on delay in govt formation in Goa
229.article_body: Goa Leader of Opposition Digambar Kamat said that even after a week’s time since the Assembly poll results were declared in Goa, there has been a delay in swearing-in the new government which indicates that "all is not well in BJP". "The people of Goa are deprived of a government to govern the state," Kamat added.

230.title: I can't see the pitch being much different: Cummins on same XI for 3rd Pak Test
230.article_body: Australia have named an unchanged playing XI for the series-deciding third Test against Pakistan, starting on Monday. Talking about it, Australia captain Pat Cummins said, "We were happy with how all 11 players [played in] last Test...[pitch] seems hard, but I can't see it being too much different from the [previous] ones." The first two Tests ended in a draw.

231.title: Every state can think on it: Pralhad on Bhagavad Gita in schools
231.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Saturday reacted to the Gujarat government's decision to introduce the Bhagavad Gita in the school syllabus, saying that every state can think about it.  "Bhagavad Gita teaches us morality and ethics. It shows us the responsibility towards wellbeing of society," he added. He further said that scripture has many moral stories that can inspire students.

232.title: BJP luring 10 Gujarat Congress MLAs, claims Rajasthan CM's adviser
232.article_body: Sanyam Lodha, an adviser to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, has claimed that BJP is allegedly trying to lure 10 Gujarat Congress MLAs ahead of the state elections later this year. "Number may eventually be more than 10... I had warned (Congress' Gujarat in charge) Raghu Sharma a month ago but there was no response, so I tweeted," Lodha said.

233.title: Sanctions against Russia over Ukraine outrageous: Chinese minister
233.article_body: Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Le Yucheng on Saturday said the sanctions against Russia over the Ukraine situation "are getting more and more outrageous". He said that the Russian citizens were being deprived of overseas assets for no reason. "The consequences of forcing a major power, especially a nuclear power, into a corner are even more unimaginable," Yucheng added.

234.title: Target is 2024 LS polls, needs more hard work: Mulayam to SP cadre
234.article_body: SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav has addressed the party workers by saying that the next "target is 2024" general elections and will require "more hard work and strengthening of the party". Speaking at a Holi gathering in Saifai, Yadav praised the workers for their effort which helped SP in getting its highest vote share ever in the UP Assembly elections.

235.title: Karnataka govt provides 'Y' category security to HC judges who gave hijab verdict
235.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said that 'Y' category security will be provided to three judges of Karnataka High Court, including Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi, who recently upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions. This comes after a video of a person threatening to kill Justice Awasthi surfaced online. Three persons have been booked in this connection.

236.title: Around 100 injured as makeshift gallery collapses at football ground in Kerala
236.article_body: Around 100 people are said to be injured after a makeshift gallery collapsed at a football ground in Kerala. The gallery was made of bamboo and areca nut tree slats and collapsed after it couldn't withstand pressure with hundreds of people sitting on it to watch a football match. Several of the injured had broken legs and arms. reports said.

237.title: Rahul gave me bowling, he's my favourite captain: Shreyas Iyer
237.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has praised KL Rahul's captaincy, stating that the 29-year-old has a "very calm demeanour" and his on-field decision making is very "instinctive". Iyer added, "I really enjoyed playing under him. Also, he gave me three overs of bowling [during South Africa ODIs], which none of the captains previously had done. So yeah, he's my favourite captain."

238.title: Baseless allegations made due to Raj polls next yr: Vaibhav Gehlot
238.article_body: President of the Rajasthan Cricket Association Vaibhav Gehlot has dismissed the allegations levelled at him of duping a Nashik resident. "Rajasthan Assembly polls (are) scheduled to be held next year. So, these kinds of baseless allegations will be levelled at me," said Gehlot. The FIR was lodged against 16 people, including Gehlot, at the Gangapur Police Station in Nashik.

239.title: US man wrongfully jailed for 23 years seeks $93 million in lawsuit
239.article_body: A 45-year-old man from US' Kansas has filed a lawsuit seeking $93 million (over ₹706 crore) in damages after he was wrongfully convicted for double murder. Lamonte McIntyre and his mother claimed that a detective coerced her into sex and then framed him for murder after she rejected the detective's sexual advances later. McIntyre had served 23 years in jail.

240.title: Multiple explosions at Pakistan military base spark massive fire, video surfaces
240.article_body: A massive explosion occurred in the northern Pakistani city of Sialkot on Sunday, ANI reported. Rishi Suri, editor of The Daily Milap, said that multiple explosions took place at the Sialkot military base in northern Pakistan. He said in a tweet, "Initial indications are this is an ammunition storage area. A large fire is burning. Cause as yet unverified."

241.title: Unfortunate that Congress didn't call it a genocide: Anupam on 'The Kashmir...'
241.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files', reacted to the Congress' remark wherein they said that the Kashmiri Hindus cannot be classified as "internally displaced persons". He said, "It is unfortunate that the ruling government of that time did not think of protecting or of not calling it a genocide." "It is a genocide...It's not fiction," he added.

242.title: Bhagavad Gita in textbooks will improve kids' intelligence level: Bommai
242.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that if Bhagavad Gita is incorporated in textbooks, it will improve the intelligence level among children. "What is wrong with it? The education department is also making preparations to introduce it in our state. Let them give their report first. We will then decide in this regard," he added.

243.title: SC issues notice on daughters’ plea to trace 89-year-old mother
243.article_body: The Supreme Court issued notice on a petition filed by two daughters seeking their mother’s whereabouts, a resident of Bihar’s Muzaffarpur. The 89-year-old woman was brought to Delhi’s Ganga Ram hospital for treatment in February, 2022 but remained untraced after February 26 when she was moved to an undisclosed location by her son.

244.title: Elizabeth Hurley shares old pics with Warne from their engagement celebration in SL
244.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's ex-fiancée Elizabeth Hurley took to Instagram to share old pictures with Warne from their engagement celebration in Sri Lanka. "My heart aches...I can't be in Australia for Shane's [private] funeral," she wrote. She added, "It seems too cruel that all...people who loved him will never have another Lion hug, but our memories will live forever."

245.title: Vir Das praises Ukrainian comedians for organising show in bomb shelter
245.article_body: Comedian-actor Vir Das reacted to a report saying that comedians in Ukraine's Sumy held a stand-up show in a bomb shelter amid the Russian invasion. The Kyiv Independent, a Ukraine media outlet, shared that three comedians performed for about 100 people in one of the bomb shelters in Sumy. Vir shared the report and dropped a few clapping hands emojis.

246.title: H'wood action choreographer Yannick Ben joins Samantha's 'Yashoda'
246.article_body: Hollywood action choreographer Yannick Ben has been roped in for Samantha Ruth Prabhu's action-thriller 'Yashoda'. Yannick has previously worked in films like 'Transporter 3', 'Inception' and 'Dunkirk'. He has also worked in Indian projects, including 'The Family Man', Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Raees' and Salman Khan's 'Tiger Zinda Hai'. 'Yashoda' will release in multiple languages.

247.title: Eng beat NZ by 1 wicket to register their 2nd win in Women's WC 2022
247.article_body: England defeated New Zealand by one wicket to register their second win in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup 2022. Chasing New Zealand's 203-run total England's Natalie Sciver scored 61 off 108 balls as her side managed to save a wicket and won the match in 47.2 overs. This is New Zealand's fourth defeat in six games in the tournament.

248.title: Woman dies as police constable allegedly shoots her in Punjab, probe on
248.article_body: A woman died after a police constable allegedly shot her in Punjab's Haibowal area. Police rushed to spot and found a dead woman with a bullet injury. "Investigations are going on...prima facie is yet to be confirmed....the accused, who shot the woman, was constable...He has been hospitalised due to a bullet wound by the neighbours," Police said.

249.title: Depression over southeast Bay of Bengal, Andaman Sea to intensify in 24 hrs
249.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that Saturday's low-pressure system intensified into a depression over the southeast Bay of Bengal and the adjoining south Andaman Sea on Sunday. The depression will further intensify into a deep depression in the next 24 hours, the IMD added. The IMD had earlier predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21.

250.title: Russian cosmonauts deny flight suits are inspired by Ukrainian flag
250.article_body: Russian cosmonaut Oleg Artemyev denied their flight suits are inspired by Ukrainian flag. He said, "There is no need to look for any hidden symbols." He added that the three cosmonauts who arrived at International Space Station wearing yellow suits with blue accents were graduates of Bauman Moscow State Technical University and had picked the colours of their alma mater.

251.title: China on right side of history: Chinese Minister on Ukraine crisis
251.article_body: Chinese Foreign Affairs Minister Wang Yi told reporters on Saturday that "time will prove" that the country's claims are on the "right side of history" over the Russia-Ukraine conflict. He added that the country stands for maintaining peace and its position is "in line with the wishes of most countries". Earlier, China had said that Russia has "legitimate security concerns".

252.title: Remo D'Souza pays off the loan for a contestant on sets of DID L'il Masters 5
252.article_body: Choreographer Remo D'Souza paid off the loan of an eight-year-old contestant named Himanshu on the DID Li'l Masters 5. Himanshu's mother revealed she is being harassed because she's a female rickshaw puller, and has also landed in a debt to buy the rickshaw. Hearing this, Remo said, "Please let me know the amount that's pending, I will pay it off."

253.title: Kyiv mocks Russia after shooting down their jet, shares meme
253.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv mocked Russia after shooting down Russia's Su-34. It wrote, "Another Russian Su-34 was shot down near Kyiv. It makes it, what, 94th?" It added, "Wondering what will happen first... the 100th plane or 300 rubles for $1? Tell us what you think!" The Russia-Ukraine war entered its 25th day today.

254.title: 2 dead, 23 rescued as wall of old building undergoing renovation collapses in Guj
254.article_body: Two persons died and 23 others were rescued after the wall of an old commercial building, where renovation work was underway, collapsed in Gujarat's Surat. The wall of the building's second floor collapsed when drilling activity was in progress and injured the two youths, who were standing on the ground. They were declared dead on arrival at a hospital.

255.title: I feel no. 3 is my position, but I'm ready to explore: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer
255.article_body: KKR's newly-appointed captain Shreyas Iyer has said he's ready to bat at any position in the upcoming IPL season. "On a given day, I can be a power-hitter and there can be some other player who can play anchor role...I feel number three is my position [but]...wherever team wants me to bat at...I'm ready to explore," he added.

256.title: 4 pose as ACB officers, extort ₹10 lakh from BDA officers in B'luru
256.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly posing as Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officers and extorting ₹10 lakh from Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) engineers. The accused reportedly extorted the money under the pretext of removing the engineers' names from ACB's case files. The incident came to light after one of the engineers filed a complaint in the matter.

257.title: 2 dead, 14 injured as dumper rams into 2 vehicles in Haryana's Nuh
257.article_body: Two persons, including a minor, died and 14 persons were injured after a dumper carrying stones allegedly rammed into a tractor thresher and a bus in Haryana's Nuh on Saturday. Locals and relatives of the victims alleged police officials were chasing the dumper to check for illegal mining and they fired a gunshot flattening the dumper's tyre, leading to collision.

258.title: Russia has failed to gain control of air: UK on Ukraine resistance
258.article_body: The UK Ministry of Defence has said the Ukrainian Air Force is continuing to effectively defend Ukrainian airspace. It added, "Russia has failed to gain control of the air and is largely relying on stand-off weapons launched from the relative safety of Russian airspace." It also said that gaining control of the air was one of Russia's principal objectives.

259.title: 20 including kids injured, 1 killed in shooting at car show in US
259.article_body: One person was killed and 20 others, including children, were injured in a shooting outside a car show in Dumas in US' Arkansas on Saturday, police said. One person has been taken into custody, but there may've been multiple shooters, the town's Police Chief Keith Finch said. "For something like this to happen, it's a tragedy," the event's organiser said.

260.title: 24-year-old man attacks worshippers in Canada mosque with bear spray
260.article_body: A 24-year-old man entered a mosque in Canada's Toronto and attacked people with bear spray on Saturday, said police. The worshippers at Dar Al-Tawheed Islamic Centre tackled the man, identified as Mohammad Moiz Oma, who was reportedly brandishing a hatchet. "They tackled him to the ground and apprehended him until the police showed up," said a Muslim body official.

261.title: Pope meets refugee Ukrainian children undergoing treatment in Rome
261.article_body: Pope Francis on Saturday met Ukrainian children who escaped war and are currently undergoing treatment at a paediatric hospital in Rome. He was seen talking to a girl with a bandaged head in a picture. As many as 19 children are receiving treatment for cancer, neurological conditions or war injuries caused by explosions, said the Vatican.

262.title: Was invited alone on 1st date, took all friends: Isha Koppikar on husband
262.article_body: Actress Isha Koppikar said that her husband Timmy Narang had invited her to his house for their first date. "He had invited only me alone...but I took all my friends along! I recall telling him, 'If you want me to come and meet you, they will accompany me'. There were 15 of us...we landed up at his place," Isha added.

263.title: Kashmiri Pandits will get relief when they return home in valley: Bukhari
263.article_body: Apni Party chief Altaf Bukhari said that Kashmiri Pandits will only get relief when they return to their homes in valley. While talking about 'The Kashmir Files', he said, "If rehabilitation takes place by making movie...I would have liked 50 more movies...I'm not saying do not make movies...what when such movies are made to help someone get votes?" he added.

264.title: Virat told me on the bus 'You might've to captain': Rahul recalls SA tour
264.article_body: Recalling the South Africa tour, where he captained India in the Johannesburg Test, KL Rahul said, "Like everyone else, [captaincy] came to me as a huge surprise." Rahul added, "The morning of the game, Virat (Kohli) came to me...said, 'My back is not feeling great, you might've to captain'...it's an honour not many people get....I was very happy."

265.title: 5 teenagers drown while swimming in river after playing Holi in Gujarat
265.article_body: Five teenagers drowned when they went for a swim in a local river after playing Holi in Gujarat's Devbhumi Dwarka district. Police said after home guard jawans posted there prevented the boys from jumping in the river, they entered the river from the opposite bank. "Apparently, they were not aware that the water was deep that side," an inspector said.

266.title: It was extremely difficult to wear eye lens in 'Bachchhan Paandey': Akshay
266.article_body: Akshay Kumar, when asked what was the most difficult part of shooting for 'Bachchhan Paandey', said wearing the eye lens for his character was "extremely difficult". "It was a very big lens. I would see everything blurry and that's how I used to shoot. I would just see that there is a figure in front of me," Akshay added.

267.title: Kashmir Files to be dubbed in Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam & Kannada
267.article_body: The makers of 'The Kashmir Files' have decided to dub the film in four languages. It'll be dubbed in Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam and Kannada. Written and directed by Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, the film has collected ₹141.25 crore in India so far. 'The Kashmir Files', starring Anupam Kher, Mithun Chakraborty and Pallavi Joshi, was released in theatres on March 11.

268.title: 2 persons die after drowning in water-filled ditch in UP's Bahraich
268.article_body: Two persons drowned after their motorcycle fell into a ditch filled with water in UP's Bahraich, police said on Friday. They had come to Bahraich to celebrate Holi and were returning home when the incident occurred. The duo was in an inebriated state and performing stunts on the motorcycle when they lost control and fell into the ditch, police said.

269.title: IPL created the market: Uthappa to Pakistani journalist glorifying PSL over IPL
269.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa responded to a Pakistani journalist who tried to glorify PSL over IPL. "One has to admit PSL gained worldwide popularity more quicker in an era when other boards had introduced their leagues too whereas there was no competitor in the market when IPL was born," the journalist had written. Uthappa responded, "IPL created the market!"

270.title: Hilarious: Ashneer reacts to YouTuber Ashish's 'sasta' Shark Tank acting
270.article_body: Shark Tank India's judge, BharatPe co-founder Ashneer Grover reacted to a video of the show's spoof by YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani. Taking to Instagram, Ashish shared a teaser of the show, where the entrepreneurs are seen pitching their ideas and the 'sharks' reacting to them. He captioned the post, "Entries...open for Sasta Shaark Tank." Reacting to the post, Ashneer wrote, "Hilarious!"

271.title: Mumbai Coastal Road project to be completed by Nov 2023: BMC
271.article_body: The Mumbai Coastal Road project will be completed as per the decided deadline of November 2023, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said on Saturday. Once the construction of the 10.58 km long road is complete, another 8.5 km long and 20-metre wide sea promenade between the Priyadarshini Park and the Worli side of the sea link will be added.

272.title: It will take you several generations to recover: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy to Russia
272.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said in a video address, "I want everyone to hear me now, especially in Moscow. The time has come for a meeting, it's time to talk." He added, "The time has come to restore territorial integrity and justice for Ukraine. Otherwise, Russia's losses will be such, it will take you several generations to recover."

273.title: 1 killed, 53 hurt as 2 communities clash over rash driving in MP
273.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed and about 53 others injured after Muslim and tribal communities clashed in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen, police said. Some locals had reportedly reproached a bike rider for driving rashly, following which he returned with a few others and beat them, a police official said. Later, tribals gheraoed shops belonging to Muslims, another police official said.

274.title: Director said 'Just copy what I do', reduced level of actor to monkey: Tisca
274.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said that a director once told her to "just copy" what he did. "He basically reduced the level of a trained actor to that of being a monkey. I don't see him working actively right now, but at that time, I was young, and it was hard to deal with that sort of condescension," she added.

275.title: Sweeper locks Chandigarh hospital's private ward, naps inside; suspended
275.article_body: A sweeper was suspended after he was found napping inside a private ward of a hospital in Chandigarh. Reports said that the door of the private ward was locked from inside and the sweeper opened it after some knocking. "The sweeper has been suspended and the outsourced agency has been asked to substitute him," UT Health Secretary Yashpal Garg said.

276.title: I was like who do I call when I've panic attack: Shawn post-breakup with Camila
276.article_body: Speaking about his breakup with his ex-girlfriend, Camila Cabello, singer Shawn Mendes said, "You don't realize when you're breaking up with someone [and] all the s*** that comes after it. Which is like, who do I call when I'm...in a panic attack." Shawn further said that he's on his own now. "I hate that...[but] that's my reality," he said.

277.title: Pastor killed by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur: Police
277.article_body: Maoists allegedly killed a pastor on suspicion of being a police informer, in Bastar’s Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, police said on Saturday. The police stated that a Maoist pamphlet was recovered from the spot. The deceased was dragged out of his house and attacked with sharp-edged weapons by the Maoists, Inspector General of Police, Bastar range, Sundarraj P, said.

278.title: JNU scholars move Delhi HC as admin changes their PhD supervisor
278.article_body: Two JNU research scholars moved Delhi High Court after the administration issued an order to change their PhD supervisor midstream. The University said that the decision was taken as the guide would superannuate in less than three years. The petitioners, fourth-year MPhil-PhD students, argued that adding a new person as supervisor could hamper their ability to complete research.

279.title: Ferrari's Leclerc beats Red Bull's Verstappen, gets pole at Bahrain GP
279.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc beat Red Bull's Max Verstappen to claim pole position in the first qualifying session of the 2022 Formula One season at the Bahrain Grand Prix. Leclerc finished with a time of 1:30:558. Leclerc's teammate at Ferrari Carlos Sainz finished in third place while Verstappen's teammate at Red Bull Sergio Perez finished in fourth place.

280.title: Bengal BJP MP claims bomb hurled at his car after watching 'The Kashmir Files'
280.article_body: Jagannath Sarkar, BJP MP from West Bengal's Ranaghat, has alleged that a bomb was hurled at his car while he was returning after watching the film 'The Kashmir Files'. "We escaped the bomb narrowly. No one is secure in Bengal...Democracy has been toppled by the state government," he said. Sarkar added that President's rule should be imposed in the state.

281.title: 2 groups clash after objection over playing DJ music near mosque in UP
281.article_body: Six people were arrested after members of two communities pelted stones at each other after getting into argument over playing of DJ music during Holi in Amroha district. Police said group was playing DJ music in empty plot next to mosque in Kotwali area, following which a group of people objected to music being played. The argument soon turned violent.

282.title: Heavy vehicles barred from entering Faridabad during day till April 4
282.article_body: Heavy vehicles will be barred from entering Faridabad during the day from March 19 to April 4 to avoid congestion during Surajkund International Crafts Mela. "Thousands of commuters travel to attend the Surajkund mela due to which there is heavy congestion...Heavy vehicles can only enter Faridabad between midnight and 7 am till April 4," said an official.

283.title: 3 parking employees held for extortion in Chandigarh's Sector-26 grain market
283.article_body: The Chandigarh Police, while acting on the directions of the Punjab and Haryana HC, arrested a parking manager and his two staffers for charging entry fees at the Sector 26 grain market. The HC bench had directed police to register a criminal case against the market's parking contractor if his staff is found charging a parking fee.

284.title: Ukrainian Foreign Minister shares pic of ruins of theatre bombed by Russia
284.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba took to Twitter to share a picture of ruins of the drama theatre in Mariupol bombed by Russia. "Inhuman Russian war crime. I want to ask multinational companies still working with or in Russia: how can you keep doing business with them? How can you feed, serve, and pay those who did this?" he wrote.

285.title: Ghaziabad aims to vaccinate 1.44 lakh in 12-15 age group in 15 days
285.article_body: After being given a target by the state health department to vaccinate 1,44,000 children in the 12-15 age group, Ghaziabad district health department officials said that they aim to achieve the target within a fortnight. According to Additional Chief Medical Officer Dr Sunil Tyagi, 15 centres in the district have a "given supply of Corbevax vaccines".

286.title: ASI killed, 10 injured after mob sets Bihar police station on fire
286.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) was killed and 10 others were injured after a mob allegedly set fire to a police station over a custodial death in Bihar's Bettiah on Saturday. The police fired 15 rounds and resorted to lathi-charge to stop the mob. Earlier, a man who was reportedly playing orchestra during Holi celebrations had died in police custody.

287.title: Video of death threat against K'taka HC Chief Justice surfaces after hijab judgement
287.article_body: Police have registered a case and booked three persons in Tamil Nadu over a video of a person threatening to kill Karnataka High Court Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi and others. It comes days after the judgement of the court upholding the ban on hijab in educational institutions. The three accused are functionaries of the Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamath (TNTJ).

288.title: My husband gets very affected: Sunny on trolls attacking their parenting
288.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone said her husband Daniel Webber gets very affected when anything is said about their children, especially Nisha, who they adopted and when trolls attack their parenting. "I don't read [such comments on social media]. Daniel, on the other hand, reads everything...It hurts his feelings," Sunny added. "He's extremely sensitive about children, especially Nisha," she said.

289.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases fall below 2,000, active cases at 26,240
289.article_body: India has reported 1,761 new COVID-19 cases and 127 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 127 deaths, 21 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 106 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,479, and the active cases declined to 26,240.

290.title: Woman said father's body was chopped into 50 pieces: Pallavi on 'The Kashmir..'
290.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi, while talking about interviews for 'The Kashmir Files', said that a woman said her father was shot dead and that his body was chopped into fifty pieces and stuffed into a sack. "When the sack surfaced after 2-3 days, they identified the body with a piece of ID card on the body," Pallavi recalled woman saying.

291.title: At least 40 benefitted from accident insurance scheme since April 2020: PMC
291.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has said that at least 40 property taxpayers have received compensation worth ₹1.63 crore under its Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay accident insurance scheme since April 2020. Under the scheme, if the spouse of a taxpayer dies in an accident, the family gets ₹5 lakh, while in case of death of a child, it gets ₹2.5 lakh.

292.title: Word 'pan-India' irks me, I don't think anyone says pan-America: Dulquer
292.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan talked about the term 'pan-India film', which has been used for films like 'Baahubali', 'Pushpa: The Rise', and the upcoming 'RRR'. "The word pan-India really irks me. I just don't like hearing it," he said, adding, "I love that there's so much exchange of talent happening in cinema...but we're one country. I don't think anyone says pan-America."

293.title: Not looking way ahead, not looking at IPL 2022 as comeback: Hardik Pandya
293.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya, who last featured for India in the 2021 T20 World Cup, has said he's not looking at IPL 2022 as his comeback. "I just want to be in a positive mindset and [not look] way ahead...If I do things right, then things will fall into place," he stated. Titans will play against LSG on March 28.

294.title: We're going to play real hard and tough cricket this season: PBKS' Mayank
294.article_body: Mayank Agarwal, who'll lead PBKS for the first time as full-time captain this IPL season, has said they're going to play real hard and tough cricket. "It's going to be a high-intensity tournament, and while we are on the field, we mean business, pure business," he added. PBKS will begin their campaign against RCB on March 27.

295.title: Told Pallavi our lives will be at risk: Vivek Agnihotri on 'The Kashmir Files'
295.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, while talking about 'The Kashmir Files', said he told wife and actress Pallavi Joshi their lives would be at risk and that the path is filled with thorns. "I told Pallavi...our credibility will...be discredited...biggest issue I had was...if we fail in this, no one will...attempt to make film on this topic for next 100 years," he added

296.title: Punjab man returning from Sri Anandpur Sahib dies as truck turns over car
296.article_body: A 50-year-old man, Gurdeep Singh, was killed while his wife, brother-in-law and another relative suffered injuries after a truck turned over their car in Jugiana village in Punjab. They were returning after paying their obeisance at Sri Anandpur Sahib on Hola Mohalla. Police have lodged an FIR against the unidentified driver of the truck who ran away from the spot.

297.title: 8-yr-old girl severely burnt by hot oil as puri bhaji vendors fight in Mumbai
297.article_body: An eight-year-old girl sustained severe burn injuries on her face and chest after hot oil fell on her during a fight between two puri bhaji vendors in Mumbai's Kurla, police said. The vendors, who were arrested later, run a food stall in Kasaiwada. The incident took place when the accused banged against a metal wok containing hot oil while fighting.

298.title: Working for Jeff Bezos was relentless, unforgiving: Former assistant
298.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' former executive assistant Ann Hiatt said working for Bezos was "relentless" and the environment could be "unforgiving". She told Insider, "In a single word (relentless), is who he is and who he wants his employees and...company to be." Notably, Bezos initially thought of naming the e-commerce giant 'Relentless.com' and the domain still leads to Amazon's website.

299.title: 2 dead, 1 critical as speeding bike hits divider, falls off flyover in Greater Noida
299.article_body: Two men died and another was critically injured after the bike they were travelling on hit a divider and fell off a flyover in the Surajpur area of Greater Noida, police said. "The three men were friends and had stepped out of their homes to play Holi. They were travelling on a bullet motorcycle and were over-speeding," Surajpur SHO said.

300.title: He's a frequent traveller to India, yet he hasn't received visa so far: CSK on Moeen Ali
300.article_body: Referring to all-rounder Moeen Ali having not joined the CSK squad yet, the team's CEO Kasi Viswanathan said that he had applied for visa on February 28 but hasn't received it yet. "He has been a frequent traveller to India and yet he has not got the travel papers," he added. He further said that even BCCI is helping them.

301.title: Hyd Police urge to keep distance between vehicles on road, share video
301.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share video on road safety. Police urged public to maintain distance between vehicles on road. "A driver driving behind another vehicle shall keep sufficient distance, commensurate with the traffic conditions, from the vehicle ahead, so as to be able to stop safely if the vehicle ahead suddenly slows down or stops," the tweet said.

302.title: 4 kill man after he objects to throwing colour during Holi in Pune
302.article_body: Four people have been booked after they allegedly murdered a 21-year-old man who objected to them throwing colour on him during Holi celebrations in Pune's Bibvewadi. The incident occurred on Friday when the accused, who were riding a two-wheeler, threw colour on the deceased. "The accused are absconding and teams have been deployed to nab them," a police official said.

303.title: Ephedrine worth ₹9.23cr found hidden in utensils at B'luru airport
303.article_body: Authorities said on Saturday that they have seized ephedrine worth ₹9.23 crore from the export shed at Bengaluru airport's cargo section, which had been hidden in a consignment declared as kitchen utensils. The package was being exported to Australia and contained ephedrine weighing 46.799 kg. Ephedrine had been concealed in the cavity of some of the utensils, the authorities added.

304.title: IPL 2014 Purple Cap winner Mohit Sharma working as net bowler for GT, fans react
304.article_body: Pacer Mohit Sharma, who had won the Purple Cap in IPL 2014 for taking 23 wickets for CSK, is working as a net bowler for Gujarat Titans. The 33-year-old pacer, who had a base price of ₹50 lakh, had gone unsold in mega auction. Reacting to the news, a fan tweeted, "Time is very powerful." "What a turnaround," wrote another.

305.title: Fire breaks out at car product factory in Pune; no casualties
305.article_body: A fire broke out at a car care product manufacturing unit in Pune's Kasurdi village on Saturday, reportedly gutting a lot of raw material. There were some workers manufacturing chemicals at the time, however, there were no casualties. "Our teams reached the spot fast. Firemen brought the situation under control in a couple of hours," said a fire official.

306.title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates $281 mn to Boys & Girls Clubs of America
306.article_body: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated $281 million to Boys & Girls Clubs of America, marking the largest gift by an individual in the organisation's 160-year history. "Gifts like this are rare and have incredible impact," the organisation's President Jim Clark said. MacKenzie, who divorced Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos in 2019, has a net worth of $54.4 billion, as per Bloomberg.

307.title: Google rolls out feature to delete last 15 mins of search history on Android app
307.article_body: Google has started rolling out a feature that lets users delete the last 15 minutes of their search history on Android app. The feature will be rolled out to everyone in the next few weeks. To check if it's available, users can go to Google's Android app, tap on their profile picture and look for "Delete last 15 min" option.

308.title: Which countries are buying Russian oil & which countries have stopped doing so?
308.article_body: Amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Bulgaria, China, European Union, France, Germany continue to buy Russian oil. Indian ONGC's subsidiary Hindustan Petroleum and India's top refiner Indian Oil also recently bought oil from Russia. Many nations like Britain, Canada and US have stopped buying Russian oil. Australian refiner Ampol, Italian state-owned Eni have also stopped buying oil from Russia.

309.title: How does the 2022 Women's World Cup points table read after Australia's record win?
309.article_body: After registering the highest successful run chase in Women's World Cup history against India, Australia qualified for the semi-finals. Australia are on top of the points table with five wins out of five matches. India are currently fourth on the table, while Pakistan are last on the table having lost all of their matches so far.

310.title: PM Modi gifts Japanese PM Kishida a 'Krishna Pankhi' made of sandalwood
310.article_body: PM Narendra Modi gifted his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida a 'Krishna Pankhi', an artefact made of pure sandalwood in Rajasthan. The Japanese PM is on a two-day visit to India. The artefact is intricately carved with traditional tools and has a hand-carved peacock figure at the top. The windows on the artefact depict different poses of Lord Krishna.

311.title: He changed his mind a fraction: Smith on why Babar missed out on his 200
311.article_body: Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith has revealed why Pakistan captain Babar Azam couldn't score a double century in the drawn second Pakistan-Australia Test in Karachi. "When he was on a 196, perhaps he was looking for a boundary maybe through the off-side and just changed his mind a fraction knowing that he was so close to his 200," he added.

312.title: Sri Lanka cancels exams over paper shortage amid economic crisis
312.article_body: Exams for millions of school students in Sri Lanka were cancelled due to a shortage of paper, officials said on Saturday. "School principals cannot hold the tests as printers are unable to secure foreign exchange to import necessary paper and ink," the Education Department of Western Province said. Notably, this comes amid a severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka.

313.title: WHO lists 3 misleading facts amid surge in COVID-19 cases
313.article_body: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases globally, WHO's Maria Van Kerkhove listed three misleading facts about the virus that is causing confusion among people. "The misinformation that Omicron is mild. Misinformation that the pandemic is over. Misinformation that this is the last variant that we will have to deal with. This is really causing a lot of confusion," she stated.

314.title: We want democratic 'Khela Hobe' in WB, says BJP's Keya Ghosh
314.article_body: The BJP's candidate for Ballygunge Assembly by-polls, Keya Ghosh, on Saturday said they "don't want 'Khela Hobe' of murdering people but democratic 'Khela Hobe'". Her remark was in reference to TMC's slogan 'Khela Hobe' (Game's on). Commenting further about TMC candidate Babul Supriyo she said, "Earlier, he asked for votes for BJP and now he'll ask...against...People will laugh at him."

315.title: Fabric that can 'hear' a person's heartbeat made by MIT engineers
315.article_body: Engineers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a fabric that can detect a wearer's subtle heartbeat. The fabric works like a microphone, converting sound into mechanical vibrations, then into electrical signals. It can detect sounds ranging in decibel from a quiet library to heavy road traffic. The fabric can also determine the precise direction of sudden sounds.

316.title: 20-year-old Indian shuttler Lakshya enters maiden final at All England
316.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen beat defending champion Lee Zii Jia of Malaysia 21-13, 12-21, 21-19 to reach his maiden final at All England Championships in Birmingham on Saturday. The 20-year-old became the fifth Indian shuttler to reach the final of the tournament. Prakash Padukone and Pullela Gopichand are the only Indians to have won the tournament.

317.title: Assam Traffic Police constable suspended for assaulting civilian
317.article_body: A traffic police constable in Guwahati, who was seen beating a motorcycle-borne man in a viral video, has been suspended for his alleged conduct of indiscipline following an order issued by deputy police commissioner. The video, which surfaced on Friday, shows a man travelling with his family before being repeatedly assaulted by constable Fakhruddin Ahmed at the Paltan Bazar area.

318.title: What's the criteria for making it tax-free?: 'Jhund' producer on 'The Kashmir Files'
318.article_body: After 'The Kashmir Files' was made tax-free in some states, a producer of Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund' raised questions on the criteria on which a government "selects a film to support it so strongly". Saying that she was "perplexed" by state governments' support to 'The Kashmir Files', Savita Raj Hiremath said, "'Jhund' is also an important film and has a...big message."

319.title: Unlimited bouncers, bodyline bowling should be allowed in Test cricket: Shoaib Akhtar
319.article_body: Former Pakistani fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that unlimited bouncers and bodyline bowling should be allowed in Test match cricket, adding, "Why not? I want some character." He added, "Nowadays, [fast bowlers] are very soft. I don’t think the aggression is as much there now. I don’t know why."

320.title: Ukraine's Prez warns invasion will cost Russia for generations
320.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said continuing with its invasion of Ukraine would cost Russia losses that will take it "several generations to recover". Zelenskyy has urged Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the invasion and hold peace talks with him. Notably, the advance of Russian forces has largely stalled amid heavy losses and local resistance, according to Reuters.

321.title: Bring back Subhas Chandra Bose's remains after DNA test: Netaji's grandnephew to Kishida
321.article_body: Amid Japanese PM Fumio Kishida's India visit, Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's grandnephew Chandra Kumar Bose has requested Kishida to bring back Netaji's purported remains from Japan's Renkoji temple. "Request [Kishido] to facilitate DNA test of #Renkoji remains of the Hero of Asia & bring back the remains to India- the land he liberated from clutches of British imperialism," he tweeted.

322.title: Ghulam Nabi Azad meeting Sonia is a good sign: Mallikarjun Kharge
322.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday said that G-23 leader Ghulam Nabi Azad meeting party President Sonia Gandhi was a good sign as Azad said he wants to strengthen the party. He added, "Azad has been in the party for years. He knows everything...He met Sonia Gandhi. He has spoken about keeping the party together."

323.title: Amit Shah reviews security situation in J&K, orders strengthening of NCB
323.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah today chaired a security review meeting with senior officials at Raj Bhawan in Jammu. During the meeting, Shah appreciated the improvement in the security situation and reduction in terror incidents in the valley, the Ministry of Home Affairs said. He ordered further strengthening of the Narcotics Control Bureau in J&K to choke narco-terrorism, MHA added.

324.title: We may not produce enough crops to export due to war: Ukraine
324.article_body: Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleh Ustenko on Saturday said Ukraine may not produce enough crops to export due to war between Ukraine and Russia. "Ukraine will not be able to export grain to the world, and there will be problems if the war continues," added Ustenko. Meanwhile, UN said 816 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded on February 24.

325.title: Sri Lanka to host Asia Cup T20 tournament from Aug 27 to Sept 11
325.article_body: Sri Lanka will be hosting Asia Cup 2022 from August 27 to September 11. The tournament will be played in a T20 format. The qualifiers for the same will be played August 20 onwards. There'll be six teams in the tournament, which includes India, Pakistan, Afghanistan, Bangladesh and hosts Sri Lanka and a qualifier. Notably, India are the defending champions.

326.title: Nagaland Assembly 1st in country to go paperless with e-Vidhan project
326.article_body: Nagaland's Legislative Assembly on Saturday became the first in the country to operationalise the National e-Vidhan Application (NeVA) for conducting a session in paperless mode. Tablets or e-books have been installed on the tables of the MLAs in the Secretariat. The cost of implementing the project was shared by the Centre and the state government on a 90:10 basis.

327.title: World no. 7 Rublev beats Dimitrov to reach Indian Wells semi-finals
327.article_body: World number seven Andrey Rublev on Friday beat Grigor Dimitrov 7-5, 6-2 to reach the semi-finals of the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. Rublev's quarter-final victory was his 13th consecutive win so far. Rublev will face American Taylor Fritz in the semi-final, after Fritz beat Miomir Kecmanovic 7-6(5), 3-6, 6-1 in his quarter-final match.

328.title: Bharti Singh, who is expecting her 1st child, shares pics from her maternity shoot
328.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh, who is expecting her first child with her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa, on Saturday shared photos from the maternity photoshoot on Instagram. Sharing the photos, she wrote, "Aane wale baby ki mummy (mother to the soon-to-be-born baby)". Meanwhile, commenting on her post, Shamita Shetty wrote "Awww", while Rubina Dilaik wrote, "So pretty".

329.title: Bukayo Saka scores as Arsenal beat Aston Villa 1-0 in Premier League
329.article_body: Bukayo Saka on Saturday scored in the first-half to help Arsenal beat Aston Villa 1-0 in the Premier League. Arsenal now have 54 points in 28 games, five points behind Chelsea in third place. Arsenal play Crystal Palace next on Monday, April 4. Leeds United on Friday beat Wolves 3-2 after Luke Ayling scored the winner in the 91st minute.

330.title: Europa League quarter-finals draw out, Barcelona to face Frankfurt
330.article_body: Barcelona on Friday were drawn against Eintracht Frankfurt while West Ham United were drawn against Olympique Lyonnais in the UEFA Europa League quarter-final draw. Barcelona will face West Ham United in the semi-final if both teams win their respective quarter-final ties. The other quarter-final matches will see RB Leipzig face Atalanta while Braga will face Rangers.

331.title: 2 Chinese jets, 1 helicopter enter Taiwan air defence zone on Mar 18
331.article_body: Two Chinese Shenyang J-11 fighter jets and one Harbin Z-9 anti-submarine helicopter entered Taiwan's Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ) on Friday. In response, Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense issued radio warnings and deployed air defence missile systems to monitor the activities of the Chinese aircraft. This comes after Chinese aircraft carrier Shandong sailed through the Taiwan strait.

332.title: Court of Arbitration for Sport upholds FIFA's ban on Russian teams
332.article_body: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) on Friday said it has rejected a request by the Russian Football Union to freeze FIFA's ban on Russian teams. CAS added that the suspension of Russian teams and clubs from FIFA competitions will remain in force. Russia were scheduled to face Poland in a World Cup qualifying playoff on March 24.

333.title: We are not going to be in the race for a win: Hamilton on Bahrain GP
333.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton said he will not be able to win the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix after finishing in ninth place in the second practice session. Hamilton finished 1.2 seconds behind Red Bull's Max Verstappen. "So we are a long way off, and we are not bluffing like people assumed we were," he said.

334.title: Will prepare Shaheen physically, mentally for future challenges: Tait
334.article_body: Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait said Shaheen Shah Afridi is one of the most "dangerous" bowlers when he is fit. "I'll try to prepare him physically and mentally for future challenges," he added. The 21-year-old pacer took 78 wickets from 36 international matches last year. Tait was named Pakistan's bowling coach last month ahead of ongoing all-format series against Australia.

335.title: Japan PM invites PM Modi for Quad meet in Tokyo, calls India 'important partner'
335.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida on Saturday invited PM Narendra Modi for the Quad Summit Meeting in Tokyo and called India "a very important partner" for Japan. While addressing the 14th India-Japan Annual Summit, PM Kishida said, "We will hold the next India-Japan talks as soon as possible." Notably, India and Japan today signed several agreements in areas including cyber security.

336.title: Future Retail to hold shareholder meeting to vote on Reliance deal in April
336.article_body: Future Group companies, including Future Retail, have informed the stock exchanges that they will convene meetings of their respective shareholders and creditors in April to vote on the ₹24,713-crore deal with Reliance Retail. The development comes amid Reliance Industries' takeover of Future's stores. Future has said it's committed to taking all actions for the reversal of takeover of stores.

337.title: Blaming Gandhi family alone for election debacle is not right: Kharge
337.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday said that blaming just the Gandhi family for Congress' performance in the elections is not right. Kharge said, "We've always wanted that everyone should come together to strengthen the party...We're all responsible, mentioning the Gandhi family alone is not right." This comes after Congress' loss in the recently held Assembly elections in five states.

338.title: Video shows the moment Russian hypersonic missile blew up Ukraine's weapon storage
338.article_body: Russia has released an aerial footage of the moment its Kinzhal hypersonic missile blew up Ukraine's weapon storage. "Destruction of a weapons depot of the Armed Forces of Ukraine by high-precision missile weapons strike. We can see the exact hit of an underground hangar with weapons and ammunition," Russia tweeted. It was the first time Russia deployed Kinzhal, Interfax reported.

339.title: He's absolute livewire, massive performer: Mayank on PBKS' new buy Shikhar
339.article_body: Talking about Shikhar Dhawan, who was bought by PBKS in IPL mega auction 2022, captain Mayank Agarwal said he's a massive performer, adding a lot of players will feed off his energy. "He's an absolute livewire, a great entertainer...he's also in...great mind space," he added. With 587 runs from 16 matches, Shikhar was top-scorer for DC in IPL 2021.

340.title: Pak military is not taking sides in political crisis: Opp'n leader
340.article_body: During a TV interview, Leader of Opposition in Pakistani Parliament Shehbaz Sharif said that the military has not taken any sides in the current political crisis in the country. The Opposition has tabled a no-confidence motion against Pakistan's PM Imran Khan. Voting on the no-confidence motion is likely to be held on March 28, according to a report.

341.title: Dhanush makes 1st public appearance after divorce from Aishwarya Rajinikanth
341.article_body: Pictures have surfaced of actor Dhanush with his sons Yatra and Linga at a concert by lyricist Ilaiyaraaja in Chennai. This is the actor's first public appearance after his divorce from Aishwarya Rajinikanth in January 2022. The actor was also seen singing on the stage during the concert, in videos shared by fans online.

342.title: 'Human error' a factor in Abu Dhabi F1 race controversy but result valid: FIA report
342.article_body: FIA released its report on the F1 2021's controversial season-ending Abu Dhabi race, which saw Max Verstappen overtake Lewis Hamilton in the final lap. FIA said "human error" was responsible for the incorrect application of safety car rules, however, the then race director Michael Masi acted in "good faith". The report ruled result of the race is "valid and final".

343.title: Russia has lost $860 million this year due to internet shutdowns: Report
343.article_body: A report by an independent research firm Top10VPN.com has revealed that a deliberate internet outage has led Russia to lose $861 million since January 2022. Ranking at the top spot, Russia is followed by Kazakhstan's losses at $429.5 million. As per NetBlocks, this cost represents how much a country's population could lose from censorship of the internet and social media.

344.title: Russia's richest man's property worth $116 million seized by Italy
344.article_body: Italian authorities have seized a building complex owned by Russian businessman Alexei Mordashov, Prime Minister Mario Draghi's office announced. The property is located on the Mediterranean island of Sardinia and is worth around $116 million. Earlier this month, a 215-foot yacht worth more than $71 million, called the "Lady M", belonging to Russia's richest man Mordashov was impounded in Italy.

345.title: Whole world has been shaken, close partnership important for Japan & India: Japan PM
345.article_body: In a joint statement with PM Narendra Modi, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said, "The whole world has been shaken today due to many disturbances. It's very important for India and Japan to have a close partnership." Stating that both the leaders talked about Russia-Ukraine war, PM Kishida said, "We need a peaceful solution on the basis of international law."

346.title: Japan to invest ₹3.2 lakh crore over the next 5 years in India: PM Modi
346.article_body: While releasing a joint statement with Japanese PM Fumio Kishida in Delhi, PM Narendra Modi said Japan will raise its investment target in India to 5 trillion yen or ₹3.2 lakh crores over the next five years. "Japan is one of India's largest investors. India-Japan are working as 'One team- One project' on Mumbai-Ahmedabad high-speed rail corridor," he added.

347.title: Will provide all possible support to Japanese firms in India: PM Modi
347.article_body: Speaking at India-Japan Economic Forum on Saturday, PM Narendra Modi said that India is committed to providing all possible support to Japanese companies in India. He further said, "Progress, prosperity and partnership are the basis of India-Japan relations." This comes as PM Modi today met Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, who's on a two-day visit to India, and held bilateral talks.

348.title: At least 130 people rescued from theatre bombed by Russia: Ukraine
