348.article_body: Ukrainian officials said at least 130 people have been rescued from a theatre in Mariupol that Ukraine said was bombed by Russia on Wednesday. Officials added that over 1,300 people remain trapped under the rubble as President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said rescue operations continue at the site. No confirmations have been given so far as to the number of possible casualties.

349.title: UK donates 2 million medical items to Ukraine in past 3 weeks
349.article_body: The UK has donated two million medical items to Ukraine over the past three weeks. "We're leading the humanitarian effort to support Ukraine by providing targeted medical support to those in need," UK Health Secretary Sajid Javid said. The Department of Health and Social Care said insulin shots, painkillers and intensive care equipment will reach Ukraine in the coming days.

350.title: Russian Prez Putin is in better shape than ever: Belarus' Prez
350.article_body: Belarus' President Alexander Lukashenko has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "in better shape than ever". "I'm absolutely privy to all his details, as far as possible, both state and personal," he added. Notably, this comes after British PM Boris Johnson has suggested Putin is being "irrational" and Dutch PM Mark Rutte has described him as "totally paranoid".

351.title: UK's luxury department store Harrods admits to 'mistakenly' selling Russian vodka
351.article_body: Luxury British department store Harrods admitted that it "mistakenly" sold an expensive brand of Russian vodka, having previously removed the bottles after sanctions against Russia due to the Ukraine war. Harrods spokesperson said, "After an inquiry by a customer, it was mistakenly brought out of stock and given to the customer. This was an error and shouldn't have happened."

352.title: Greek farmers protest against rising fuel prices amid Ukraine war
352.article_body: Hundreds of Greek farmers on Friday protested against high fuel and fertiliser prices that have increased following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Greek government has spent over $4 billion since September to help farmers, businesses and households from rising energy and fuel costs. The UN food agency last week said international food prices could rise by up to 20%.

353.title: Zoo near Kyiv requests humanitarian corridor to evacuate animals
353.article_body: A zoo near Kyiv has requested a humanitarian corridor to evacuate animals or for volunteers to bring food for larger animals amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The owner of the Park XII Months zoo Mykhailo Pinchuk said there is no electricity or gas in the park. Animals in the zoo have reportedly begun to die due to cold or hunger.

354.title: KKR is a lucky team for me, delighted to be back: Pacer Umesh
354.article_body: Pacer Umesh Yadav, who was part of KKR's title-winning campaign in IPL 2014, said he's delighted to be back in the Kolkata-based franchise. "Because KKR has given me that experience of winning a trophy so you can say that KKR is a lucky team for me," he added. The 34-year-old had represented DC in IPL 2021.

355.title: Bhavana makes 1st public appearance after rape incident, gets standing ovation
355.article_body: Malayalam actress Bhavana Menon made a surprise appearance at the International Film Festival of Kerala (IFFK) on Friday. This was Bhavana's first public appearance after she was allegedly abducted and raped by actor Dileep and others in a car in 2017. She received thunderous applause and a standing ovation from the crowd, a video of which has also surfaced.

356.title: How does the Cricket World Cup Super League table read after Bangladesh's historic win?
356.article_body: After their first-ever ODI victory on South African soil, Bangladesh are on top of Cricket World Cup Super League points table with 110 points. South Africa are at the 10th position, while Australia are seventh. England are second on the table and India are on third position. Pakistan are ninth. Top-seven ranked teams will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

357.title: AIMIM is BJP's 'B team' which was proved in UP polls: Sanjay Raut
357.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Saturday dubbed Asaduddin Owaisi-led AIMIM as the "B team" of BJP. "The AIMIM has a secret alliance with the BJP which was proved in Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal elections," he said. Raut also rejected the suggestion of AIMIM to be part of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) alliance in Maharashtra.

358.title: Real warning sign for other teams: Lisa on Harmanpreet's 57* vs Aus in WC
358.article_body: Calling Harmanpreet Kaur's 47-ball 57* against Australia "an excellent innings" in ongoing Women's World Cup, ex-Australia captain Lisa Sthalekar said the India vice-captain was able to build up the half-century. "It's a real warning sign for other teams that she is starting to fire because we know how big she can go," she added. Australia beat India by six wickets.

359.title: Pakistan logs 483 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths in last 24 hours
359.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Saturday said the country reported 483 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 2 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to 30,328. This comes as NCOC announced relaxation of all COVID-19 norms in the country. However, positivity rate has jumped up to 1.23% from 1.08%.

360.title: Nearly 200 people wounded in Sudan's anti-coup protests: Report
360.article_body: Central Committee of Sudan Doctors (CCSD) on Friday said 187 anti-coup protesters were wounded in clashes with police in Khartoum on March 17. This comes as riot police used rubber bullets and tear gas to disperse the protesters who were marching towards the Republican Palace, seat of the military government. Sudan has plunged into crisis since last year's military coup.

361.title: Taiwan reports 126 new COVID-19 cases, zero deaths in last 24 hours
361.article_body: Taiwan on Saturday logged 126 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths in last 24 hours. As per Taiwan's Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC), out of 126 new cases, 120 were imported cases and six were locally transmitted infections. The agency added that out of the new local infections, three were contacts of recently confirmed cases.

362.title: Very happy to start new journey: Gill on joining GT camp ahead of IPL
362.article_body: Upon his arrival in the Gujarat Titans squad in Ahmedabad ahead of upcoming IPL 2022, Shubman Gill said he's very happy to start his new journey with the franchise. "I'll be out there on the field very soon," he added. Gill, who was released by KKR before IPL mega auction last month, was picked by Gujarat Titans for ₹8 crore.

363.title: India may soon top hate and anger charts: Rahul Gandhi
363.article_body: Citing India's global ranking on various parameters, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted that India may soon "top the Hate and Anger charts!". "Hunger Rank: 101, Freedom Rank: 119, Happiness Rank: 136," he wrote in the tweet. Notably, Rahul Gandhi's comment comes after India moved up three spots this year in the UN-sponsored World Happiness Report.

364.title: Hyd Police seizes illegal gutka, tobacco products worth ₹2 lakh
364.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday apprehended two persons for allegedly buying and selling noxious gutka and seized illegal gutka and tobacco products worth ₹2,47,050 from their possession. According to police, one of the accused purchased the gutka from Karnataka and distributed it at pan shops in and around the Secunderabad area and had also hired a godown for storage of goods.

365.title: CBSE announces Class 12 Term 1 examination results
365.article_body: The Central Board of Secondary Education on Saturday announced the results of Class 12 Term 1 examination. The CBSE has reportedly sent marksheets of the examination to individual schools. The Class 10 Term 1 result was announced last week in offline mode, and the students' marksheets were shared with schools over mail.

366.title: UK woman left 4 inches shorter after water slide accident, seeks £500,000 damages
366.article_body: A British tourist has said she was left four inches shorter after breaking her spine on a 40-foot-tall "Banzai" water slide while she was on a holiday in Spain. Jennifer Proctor said the 2019 accident led to her height being reduced to 5 feet 7 inches and has launched a £500,000 (₹5 crore) damages claim against Aqualand waterpark in Mallorca.

367.title: 28-yr-old woman finds 10kg tumour with teeth & hair growing inside ovary in US
367.article_body: A 28-year-old US woman has said she discovered a nearly 10-kg tumour with teeth and hair was growing inside her ovary when she consulted a doctor after struggling to lose weight. She was diagnosed with a teratoma tumour, which is a slow-growing tumour. "I was in shock, as that's like having three kids inside of you," the woman said.

368.title: VHP condemns attack on ISKCON temple in Dhaka, demands strict action
368.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad has condemned the attack on an ISKCON temple in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka, saying the attack is "very worrying and exposes the human rights and Islamophobia". VHP also urged the Bangladesh government  to ensure the safety of Hindus and give punishment to the attackers. The temple was reportedly attacked on Thursday by a mob of around 200 people.

369.title: US dentist found guilty of breaking patients' teeth to earn profit by fixing them
369.article_body: A dentist in the US has been found guilty of healthcare fraud and other charges after he purposely damaged his patients' teeth to bill insurance companies for further procedures to earn profit. The 61-year-old dentist billed over $4.2 million for crown procedures between 2016 and 2019. Notably, by the end of 2020, he had over $6.8 million worth of assets.

370.title: Fielding didn't back the bowlers: Mithali on India's loss vs Aus in WC
370.article_body: After India's six-wicket loss against Australia in 2022 Women's World Cup, India captain Mithali Raj said her side's fielding didn't back the bowlers when they needed the fielders to stand up and support them. "Next two games become very important and we would look to do well in all departments," she added. India are currently fourth in standings.

371.title: Be alert: Centre to Maha as COVID-19 cases rise in China, S Korea
371.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said on Saturday that the state government received a letter from the Central government, asking it to stay alert as COVID-19 cases are increasing in China, South Korea and European nations. "Accordingly, our health department had issued a letter to DCs to be cautious and take necessary steps," he added.

372.title: We are not opposing moral education: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah
372.article_body: Leader of the Opposition in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly and former Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday said, "We're not opposing moral teachings. We believe in the constitution and secularism."  "Let the government teach Bhagavad Gita, Quran or Bible as part of moral education," he added. "We don't have any objection, provided children get quality education," he further said.

373.title: Police seizes 5 kg methadone worth ₹5 crore in MP; 2 arrested
373.article_body: Police and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) on Friday intercepted a truck on the Betul-Nagpur Highway in Madhya Pradesh and recovered 5 kg of the drug methadone worth ₹5 crore. The two occupants of the truck, who were arrested, claimed to be carriers transporting the consignment from Assam to Mandsaur, police said, adding that further probe is underway.

374.title: Netherlands to increase wind farms for doubling wind capacity by 2030
374.article_body: The Netherlands to increase offshore wind farms for doubling the planned capacity by 2030. A source revealed that government is set to announce new wind farms with a capacity of 10.7 gigawatts (GW) that would be built by end of this decade. This comes as government is working to achieve its climate goals and lessen reliance on Russian gas.

375.title: Hyd Police seize 16g brown sugar transported from WB; 4 arrested
375.article_body: A Special Operations Team of Hyderabad Police on Saturday busted an interstate drugs racket and apprehended four persons involved. Around 16 grams of brown sugar were seized from their possession which, according to police, was transported from West Bengal to Hyderabad. Police also seized five mobile phones, ₹1,900 in cash and a weighing machine among other materials.

376.title: Over 2,000 people fined for traffic violations on Holi in Delhi: Police
376.article_body: Delhi Police on Saturday said that more than 2,000 people were fined for traffic violations in the city on the occasion of Holi. Police said that 1,673 persons have been prosecuted for travelling without a helmet on Holi. Furthermore, the police said that 275 persons have been prosecuted for triple riding, 196 for drunken driving and 25 for dangerously driving.

377.title: 26-yr-old Mumbai man dies after falling off terrace during Holi
377.article_body: A 26-year-old man died after falling from the terrace of a four-storey building in Mumbai's Ambernath where he had tried to hide while playing Holi with his friends on Friday. Suraj More was rushed to the hospital but was declared dead during treatment. Police have registered an accidental death report in the matter and are awaiting his post-mortem report.

378.title: Ukraine is opening to the world: Vice PM as Musk sends more Starlink terminals
378.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to share that the country has received a new batch of Starlink satellite internet terminals amid war with Russia. Thanking SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, he said, "While Russia is blocking access to the Internet, Ukraine is becoming more open to the entire world. Ukraine is the truth. The truth always wins."

379.title: What's wrong with saffronising education, shed colonial mindset: VP
379.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said the government is accused of saffronising education but "what is wrong with saffron". "We must give up our colonial mindset and teach our children to take pride in their Indian identity," he said. He also called for rejecting Macaulay's system of education in the 75th year of Independence. He made the comments in Haridwar.

380.title: What are humanitarian corridors created in Ukraine & are they safe?
380.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday said that 10 humanitarian corridors have been agreed on with the Russians. These corridors are safe passages created in war zones by stopping assault for a certain time, either to allow civilians to flee or to allow urgent humanitarian aid to enter. There have been instances of the ceasefire being breached in these corridors, including in Mariupol.

381.title: Hong Kong's COVID-19 cases cross 1 million mark since pandemic began
381.article_body: Hong Kong logged 10,16,944 COVID-19 cases since the pandemic began after the authorities reported 20,079 new infections on Friday. The officials added that the city reported 265 deaths in the same period bringing the total death toll to 5,401. Notably, nearly 97% of the overall caseload came from the current Omicron-driven outbreak which is Hong Kong's fifth wave.

382.title: 28-yr-old man shot at under reclamation bridge in Mumbai's Bandra
382.article_body: A 28-year-old man was shot by three bike-borne assailants near Mumbai's Bandra reclamation bridge on Thursday. The complainant Riyaz Ansari, who has eight criminal cases against him, alleged that two assailants threatened him before the third, Munna Pathan, fired at him. He further claimed Pathan had tried to kill him as he registered an FIR against some hotel employees earlier.

383.title: He's chilled, very approachable and a helpful soul: Shikhar on Rohit
383.article_body: Praising Rohit Sharma, India opener Shikhar Dhawan said the captain is a "gem" of a person and a very "helpful soul". He added, "He's chilled, relaxed, smart and very approachable...and he may be...captain now, but for those who know him, he's the same Rohit." As an opening combination, Rohit and Dhawan have scored 4,994 runs in 111 innings so far.

384.title: US to deploy Stryker army company as part of Bulgaria's NATO troops
384.article_body: Bulgarian PM Kiril Petkov on Saturday said US will provide a Stryker mechanised infantry company for Bulgaria's NATO battlegroup. "This is a strong sign to all our allies in NATO," he said during a joint press conference with US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin. This comes as Bulgaria is establishing a battlegroup of up to 1,000 troops amid Russia-Ukraine war.

385.title: China's Wuhan vows to create 100 billion yuan space industry by 2025
385.article_body: China's Wuhan on Wednesday vowed to create a 100 billion yuan ($15.7 billion) space industry by 2025. As per a city government notice, authorities are offering companies up to 50 million yuan ($7.88 million) as financial incentives in manufacturing projects of satellites, rockets and spacecraft. This comes as Wuhan aims to become the country's "valley of satellites".

386.title: Scientists find 36-mn-year-old fossil of ancestor of whales in Peru
386.article_body: Palaeontologists on Thursday announced that they have discovered a 36-million-year-old skull belonging to a prehistoric ancestor of modern-day whales in Peru's southern Ocucaje desert. Scientists believed that the ancient marine animal was likely a 12-metres long basilosaurus whose descendants are whales, dolphins and porpoises. The team added that the fossil contained rows of long, pointy teeth.

387.title: B'luru policemen fix tyre of ambulance carrying mother, child; praised
387.article_body: Bengaluru's Sadashivanagar Traffic ASI Pushpakaran and police constable Huded helped in replacing the punctured tyre of an ambulance, which was carrying a mother and child. "The timely help ensured the mother and child to reach the hospital in time," DCP Traffic East tweeted. Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar praised them, saying, "Great gesture Bengaluru City Traffic Police! Appreciate it!"

388.title: Ex-UK PM Cameron driving small lorry to Poland with aid for Ukrainians, shares pic
388.article_body: Former United Kingdom Prime Minister David Cameron is driving a small lorry to Poland with humanitarian aid for Ukrainian refugees. Cameron and his two Chippy Larder colleagues will give the donations to Red Cross when they reach Poland. He added that donations are filled "with everything from nappies to sanitary products, warm clothes to first-aid kits".

389.title: Brazil bans Telegram, CEO says 'company was checking wrong email id for orders'
389.article_body: After Brazil’s Supreme Court banned Telegram for facilitating disinformation and failing to comply with orders, CEO Pavel Durov issued a statement saying that the company was checking the wrong email address for communications with the court. Durov said the company had given a different email address for further communication but the court sent the orders to an old email address.

390.title: PM Modi meets Japan PM at Hyderabad House in Delhi; greet each other with Namaste
390.article_body: Japan PM Fumio Kishida, who is on a two-day visit to India, met PM Narendra Modi at Hyderabad House in Delhi on Saturday. The two leaders greeted each other with Namaste, a video of their meeting showed. Besides holding bilateral talks with PM Modi, PM Kishida will take part in the 14th India-Japan Annual Summit.

391.title: Italian researchers survey and study Europe's Calderone glacier
391.article_body: Italian researchers conducted a preliminary radar survey of Europe's Calderone glacier on March 13. As the scientists plan to study the glacier before it melts due to global warming, the team plans to return in April to drill into it and take samples. According to the researchers, these samples will be stored in 'Ice Memory' world archive in Antarctica.

392.title: B'luru Police apprehends man for cricket betting, seizes ₹1 lakh cash
392.article_body: Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru Police has conducted a raid on cricket betting gamblers and apprehended a man, identified as Sampath G, police said on Friday. Police also seized cash worth more than ₹1 lakh and a mobile phone from the possession of the accused person. This comes as India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test recently concluded in Bengaluru with India's win.

393.title: Strategic 434-km long Srinagar-Leh highway reopens after 73 days
393.article_body: The strategic 434-km long Srinagar-Leh national highway was reopened on Saturday after being closed for 73 days due to heavy snowfall, officials said. However, the officials added that the decision to open the highway for civil traffic will be taken after a joint inspection by the civil administration.

394.title: Ukrainian military imposes 38-hour curfew in Zaporizhzhia: Official
394.article_body: Zaporizhzhia Deputy Mayor Anatoliy Kurtiev on Saturday said Ukrainian military has imposed a 38-hour curfew in southern city of Zaporizhzhia. As per Kurtiev, the curfew will stay in place from today till early Monday, March 21. This comes as the regional capital city has become a vital transit point for about 35,000 civilians who have fled besieged city of Mariupol.

395.title: Cummins is happy if we drop chances as long as ball carries, jokes Smith
395.article_body: Discussing pitches for Pakistan's Tests against Australia, Steve Smith said there is no bounce, joking that Australia Test captain Pat Cummins is happy if the slip fielders drop chances as long as the ball carries. "I've never stood as close to the bat for pace bowlers in my life, in any conditions," added Smith. "It's been exceptionally difficult," stated Smith.

396.title: SP-ally Rajbhar denies meeting Shah, says 'old pic' circulating
396.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief OP Rajbhar, an ally of SP, has denied reports of him meeting Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "Those are old photos. Someone can repost the old photos and say whatever they want," said Rajbhar. "The reports are baseless. Neither did I go to Delhi nor did I meet anyone," Rajbhar added.

397.title: We must give up colonial mindset, take pride in Indian identity: Naidu
397.article_body: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday asked Indians to give up their "colonial mindset" and learn to take pride in their own identity. He also called for total rejection of the Macaulay system of education in the 75th year of Independence. "We must learn Sanskrit to know our scriptures, which are a treasure trove of knowledge," he said.

398.title: Inspired by film Valimai, 2 men steal bikes in Coimbatore; arrested
398.article_body: Inspired by the film Valimai starring Ajith, a 23-year-old man and his 17-year-old neighbour allegedly stole motorcycles in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. The Saravanampatti police arrested them on Wednesday. "Inspired by the movie, they started to steal parked motorcycles and sold them for as low as 5,000," Inspector Senthilkumar said. Police also recovered 11 motorcycles from their possession.

399.title: 25,000 jobs to be notified in 1 month: Punjab CM after cabinet meet
399.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann presided over his first cabinet meeting on Saturday and later said the cabinet passed a proposal to issue 25,000 government job notifications in one month. This includes 10,000 vacancies in Punjab Police and 15,000 vacancies in other government departments. "As we promised...job opportunities...will be the top priority of the AAP government," Mann said.

400.title: It is meant for global audience: Vidya Balan on 'Jalsa' releasing on OTT
400.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan while talking about her film 'Jalsa' getting released on OTT rather than the theatres said the film is meant for the global audience. "Both the story and the narrative are universal," said Vidya Balan. Actress Shefali Shah, who also stars in the film, added, "We all want to be a part of global cinema."

401.title: They are a part of us: Maniesh Paul on ill-treatment of LGBTQ+ community
401.article_body: Actor and TV host Maniesh Paul while expressing his disappointment on the ill-treatment of LGBTQ+ community said, "They are very much...part of us." "They are part of our world and society whom we were ignoring for a long time," he added while talking to former Mr Gay India Sushant Divgikr in the latest episode of 'The Maniesh Paul Podcast'.
